responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Argument injection in job retry functionality
    analysis: |
      The application provides a job retry functionality without proper input sanitization.
      An attacker could potentially craft a malicious payload that would be executed as a shell command during the retry attempt.
      This vulnerability could lead to remote code execution (RCE) on the server.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - lib/delayed_job_web/application.rb
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via job arguments and backtrace
    analysis: |
      The application directly displays job arguments and backtrace information without proper sanitization.
      An attacker could create a malicious job with crafted arguments or backtrace information containing JavaScript code.
      If an administrator views the job details, the attacker's script would be executed in the administrator's browser.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - lib/delayed_job_web/application.rb
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Potential Open Redirect in Ajax Polling
    analysis: |
      The Ajax polling functionality in application.js does not appear to validate or sanitize the 'href' attribute of the clicked element.
      An attacker could potentially craft a malicious link with a 'href' attribute pointing to an external malicious website.
      If an administrator clicks on this link, the polling functionality might redirect the administrator's browser to the malicious website.
    cwe: CWE-601
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - lib/delayed_job_web/application/public/javascripts/application.js
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Argument injection in job retry functionality
leads.analysis:
The application provides a job retry functionality without proper input sanitization.
An attacker could potentially craft a malicious payload that would be executed as a shell command during the retry attempt.
This vulnerability could lead to remote code execution (RCE) on the server.

leads.headline: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) via job arguments and backtrace
leads.analysis:
The application directly displays job arguments and backtrace information without proper sanitization.
An attacker could create a malicious job with crafted arguments or backtrace information containing JavaScript code.
If an administrator views the job details, the attacker's script would be executed in the administrator's browser.

leads.headline: Potential Open Redirect in Ajax Polling
leads.analysis:
The Ajax polling functionality in application.js does not appear to validate or sanitize the 'href' attribute of the clicked element.
An attacker could potentially craft a malicious link with a 'href' attribute pointing to an external malicious website.
If an administrator clicks on this link, the polling functionality might redirect the administrator's browser to the malicious website.
